text: Ricardo Chacón (born 30 April 1963) is a retired Cuban sprinter. He represented his country at one outdoor and two indoor World Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1985 |Universiade |Kobe, Japan |bgcolor=gold|1st |4 × 100 m relay |38.76 |- |rowspan=2|1986 |rowspan=2|Ibero-American Championships |rowspan=2|Havana, Cuba |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |100 m |10.36 |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4 × 100 m relay |39.46 |- |rowspan=3|1987 |World Indoor Championships |Indianapolis, United States |21st (h) |60 m |6.79 |- |Pan American Games |Indianapolis, United States |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4 × 100 m relay |38.86 |- |World Championships |Rome, Italy |31st (qf) |100 m |10.70 |- |1988 |Ibero-American Championships |Mexico City, Mexico |1st (extra) |100 m |10.36 |- |1989 |World Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |7th (sf) |60 m |6.59 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *100 metres – 10.21 (+0.3 m/s, Havana 1987) *200 metres – 20.86 (+1.9 m/s, Sofia 1989) Indoor *60 metres – 6.57 (Oviedo 1989) ==References== * *All- Athletics profile Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Cuban male sprinters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1987 Pan American Games Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Cuba Category:Pan American Games competitors for Cuba Category:Pan American Games silver medalists for Cuba Category:Pan American Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade gold medalists for Cuba
title: Ricardo Chacón
